etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Elliott Coues (1842–1889), naturalist and historian. From scientific Latin Sciuromorpha, group name from Sciurus, genus name + -morpha

definitions: A rodent of the group Sciuromorpha, which comprises the squirrels, mountain beaver, and their relatives.

notes.text: Sciuromorpha was formerly a superfamily that also included the beavers and scaly-tailed squirrels; it is now a suborder that also includes the dormice.

definitions: Of, relating to, or characteristic of the group Sciuromorpha.
